page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: MUCH OF THE BLOCK IS COVERED BY THE TOWN OF BUCKIE. BUCKIE IS A SMALL PORT WHICH DEPENDS HEAVILY ON THE FISHING INDUSTRY.MANY JOBS ARE PROVIDED BY FISHING AND BY FISHING RELATED INDUSTRIES AND SERVICES.SHOPS AND OTHER BUSINESSES ARE VERY MUCH AFFECTED BY THE PROSPERITY OF THE FISHING INDUSTRY.BUCKIE ALSO PROVIDES SHOPPING AND OTHER KEY SERVICES FOR AN AREA, EXTENDING ALONG THE COASTAL LOWLAND OF THE MORAY FIRTH,BETWEEN CULLEN AND PORTGORDON. THE OLDER PARTS OF BUCKIE ARE SITED NEAR THE SEA,AND THE NEWER HOUSING AREAS HAVE GROWN UP ON THE SOUTHERN SIDE OF THE TOWN.BUCKIE HAS A NEW INDUSTRIAL ESTATE ON THE EAST SIDE OF THE TOWN.
